definition: to faint with blurred vision (idiom); dizzy and eyes dimmed
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
confused/dizzy/giddy/to faint/to swoon/to lose consciousness/to pass out
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: The heaving of the ship made her dizzy and she leanedagainst the handrail.
sentences.chinese: 輪船的起伏讓她頭暈眼花，她斜靠在扶手上。

sentences.english: If I don’t quite hit REM, I may feel a bit groggy.
sentences.chinese: 而反之，我就會感覺有點頭暈眼花。

sentences.english: Suddenly he felt himself whirled round and round - spinning like a top.
sentences.chinese: 突然他感到頭暈眼花，像是陀螺般旋轉。

sentences.english: "Groggy" is a fun word to say.
sentences.chinese: “頭暈眼花”這個詞念起來很好玩。

sentences.english: I've kept getting a roaring in my ears and giddiness.
sentences.chinese: 我老是感到耳鳴和頭暈眼花。

sentences.english: Others say it induces nausea and dizziness.
sentences.chinese: 其他的人說這種聲音會讓人噁心和頭暈眼花。

sentences.english: The negotiators seemed punch-drunk after another all-night session .
sentences.chinese: 談判者又經過一次通宵會談，似乎都已頭暈眼花。

sentences.english: The blow on the head dazed him.
sentences.chinese: 當頭一擊把他打得頭暈眼花。

definition: top-heavy/fig. unbalance in organization or political structure
yellow face, emaciated body (idiom); malnourished and sickly in appearance
impotence/also written 陽痿|阳痿[yang2 wei3]
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
to collapse (from dehydration or loss of blood)/heat exhaustion
to feel sick/to feel nauseous/to feel disgusted
